High-level linear algebra

High-level linear algebra¶

This chapter describes all of the linear algebra operations which are not basic enough to fall within the BLAS (Basic Linear Algebra Subprograms) framework. In particular, algorithms which would traditionally have fallen into the domain of LAPACK (Linear Algebra PACKage), such as factorizations and eigensolvers, are placed here.

  • Norms
    • Norm
    • HermitianNorm
    • SymmetricNorm
    • Two-norm estimates
  • Invariants
    • Determinant
    • Trace
  • Factorizations
    • Cholesky factorization
    • factorization
    • factorization
    • factorization
    • factorization
    • factorization
  • Linear solvers
    • Cholesky solve
    • Gaussian elimination
    • Householder solve
    • Solve after Cholesky
    • Solve after LU
  • Factorization-based inversion
    • General inversion
    • HPD inversion
    • Triangular inversion
  • Reduction to condensed form
    • Hermitian to tridiagonal
    • General to Hessenberg
    • General to bidiagonal
  • Eigensolvers and SVD
    • Hermitian eigensolver
    • Skew-Hermitian eigensolver
    • Hermitian generalized-definite eigensolvers
    • Unitary eigensolver
    • Normal eigensolver
    • Schur decomposition
    • Hermitian SVD
    • Polar decomposition
    • SVD
  • Matrix functions
    • Hermitian functions
    • Pseudoinverse
    • Square root
    • Semi-definite Cholesky
  • Utilities
    • Householder reflectors

    • Applying pivots
    • Reduction of Hermitian generalized-definite EVPs
  • Tuning parameters
    • Hermitian to tridiagonal
